author: mpaulucci
content: Im looking at the consensus spec tests and I seeing some apparent inconsistency which I can't get my head around. The are some tests that are generated just for a single fork, for example the bls ones: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/master/tests/generators/bls/main.py#L533-L538 . I assume this means that the functionality/test doesn't change across forks. But on the other hand these tests is repeated for all forks: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/master/tests/generators/ssz_static/main.py#L84 and as far as I can tell, there is no difference between the tests, they just seem to be repeated?

author: sproul
content: the set of types in the SSZ static tests changes across forks, e.g. the `BeaconState` for Capella is not the same as the `BeaconState` for Bellatrix

author: sproul
content: some types will be repeated, but this is quite harmless
